nodes.text:
-------------------------------
|          CHAPTER 2          |
-------------------------------


$G<<You are alive...>>$C#

Whose is that voice?# Your own?# Have you actually heard it?

You slowly open your eyes, as thoughts resume their flow in your mind, trying to re-establish contact with reality. 

It takes several seconds to clear up your sight. You feel quite wrecked. 
Just breathing deeply is a pain. You painfully, slowly sit up, and look around. 

You don't recognize what you see. You try hard to remember, and it finally comes back to you. 
How can you still be alive after being hit by... the lightning?
By the way, you are still soaked to the bone.

$c"Maybe I am dead, afer all."#$C you say aloud, reconsidering the plausibility of that scenario. 

In the meanwhile, you look at the small reddish vale that lies downhill. 
There is smoke ascending from what it looks like several fires or maybe arsons. 

You carefully stand up, becoming dizzy until your sense of balance stabilises. 


$D[When you see the prompt "\>", type an action you want to perform. Press TAB if you need help.]$C

$CThe first thing you notice is the sky, streaked with a cloud that looks like the jetstream of a plane. 
It has a strange, alien color. 

The sun is setting, shedding its last light painting with odd glares on the celestial vault,
which is already welcoming the faint sparkle of several stars. 

A little downhill, you then notice an earth road going down towards the vale. 
It points in the direction of the fires. 
Looking more intently, you discern there must be some kind of village there. 

It looks like there's nowhere else to go, at the moment.

You find your way downhill, following the earth path. 

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees. 

Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars. 

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene. 
You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer. 

The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You won't waste time. You rush downhill flying over the earth road. 

As you descend, the path gets narrower, meandering between an increasing number of trees. 

This does not slow you down, nor the fact that running through the vegetation leaves
many marks on your skin, especially your arms and face. You don't even realize it at the moment. 

Time passes, and night falls. Light recedes and you find yourself relying on the faint light of the stars. 

As darkness takes hold, $rominous reddish glares$C paint the corners of the scene. 
You understand it's the light coming from the fires. You are getting closer. 

The trees thin out and you can see the village entry a little further in front of you.

You can't explain the reason of it to yourself, but for some reason, you start chuckling. 
Maybe it's the absurdity of the situation, or maybe it's a nervous reaction. 

Anyway, you keep on laughing, louder and louder, until your voice becomes hysterical,
distorted, overlapped with its own echo. 

After a while, you fell quite, the sound disperses around, and you feel some kind of sense of awkardness.

Your mind is rushing. 
$c<<What is this place?>>
<<Am I dead?>>
<<Am I in some hell?>>
<<How do I get home?>>
<<Is there anybody here?>>

$CAfter few moments, you burst out crying. You weren't expecting it, but you can't help it. 

After few minutes of what you classify as a pathetic scene, you feel better for some reason.

This is clearly impossible. You must be dreaming. Or maybe it's just some kind of sick prank. 

Whatever it is, it's unacceptable. You feel your rage rising, supercharged by your pain and fear. 
It soon becomes too much to hold inside, so you let out a mighty shout. 

You scream at the space around you. 
To whoever might be listening. 
To your own fate. 

You feel liberated.

You stand on this hill, like the one that is in front of your house. 
But the similarities end there. There are no places like this around your place,
maybe not even in your whole nation. 

You are still wondering what happened and how did you end up here. 
You try to keep calm, thinking about what to do next.

A small town lies in front of you. 
Or, to better say, what is left of it. 

There is one main earth road that divides two main groups of houses, and little else. 
Many buildings are in flames or already burnt to the ground. 
Few others are seemingly intact. 

There are no vehicles. 
No living soul is to be found around. 


You keep on walking, and after few seconds you spot the first one. 

$WA man.$C# Lying on his back, eyes wide open, staring into nothingness. 
An arrow stuck deep in his chest. $WClearly dead.$C# Few flies buzzing around his mouth already. 

You retch.

$c<<Where the heck am I...?# What is going on?# What am I supposed to do?>>$C you ask yourself when you feel better. 

You keep on walking and realize the road is scattered with corpses. Some kind of battle must have taken place... 

You keep on going, slowly, appalled. You lose track of time, while your mind tries to grasp the reality. 
YHow to find an explanation to any of the things you are experiencing?


#After a while, you find yourself leaning on an empty doorframe of a house, which was somehow spared by the fire. 

You shudder. This reminds you that you should find some kind of shelter for the night,
get dry, and possibly not burnt.

choices.desc: You had enough for today. Nothing you may find inside the house could be worse than what is outside.
You just can't walk through that door, into the darkness...

nodes.text:
Overcoming fear with need, you enter the silent, dark, house. You don't expect to find anybody in there. 
It's a very humble abode, earthen floor, small windows, few ornaments. 

A fireplace signals the kitchen. A table, some chairs. You suddenly realize how hungry you are. 
The only other room is the bedroom, a simple bed, a closet. 
All furniture pieces are made of the same wood. 
It doesn't look like there is running water anywhere. You can't even find a toilet. 


$D[Usually, an action (verb) has to match an object (for example: $ddrink $Dthe $dwater$D)]

[You may press TAB again for help about the objects.]$C

objects.answer: You find a loaf of bread, some unidentified fruit and some cheese.
There is a covered jug full of water on the kitchen counter.
You find a pair of trousers, and a woolen shirt. They feel rough and old.

condition.refusal: I don't want to lay down with these dirty clothes on.

objects.answer: You remove your soaked clothes wearing what you just found.

condition.refusal: I need to find something to wear first.
I need to find some water.

actions.answer: You avidly drink the water, not caring about its taste.

condition.refusal: I need to find something to eat.

actions.answer: You devour what you just found.

nodes.text:
Driven away by the thought of what you could find inside that dark place, you resume your grim exploration. 

The fires are almost out. Hostile embers spy on you from the corner of your eye. 
Not a sound, you feel and hear your own blood pumping in your veins. 

You reach what looks like the center of that lost little town. 
There is a stone landmark in the middle of the square. 
You feel a rush of gratitude when you discover it's a fountain. 

You drink in a hurry, only now realising how thirsty you were. 
The water has a funny taste, but you are too overwhelmed to notice or care. 
You collapse on the ground, the most possible distant from any building, fire, or corpse.

... 

$G<<Wake up...>>$c#

"Who's calling...?"$C you mutter sitting up on the bed, fighting to regain full consciousness. 
You open your eyes, and you become freshly aware of the current situtation. 
It feel like a boulder has been thrown down on you, again. 

You don't know how long you've been asleep. The sun must be high up already,
judging from the light that filters through the thick, dirty window. 

You don't want to spend another minute in there, so you decide to hit the road. 

Once outside, you hesitate just a moment, spectating the wasted scenario. 
Many other corpses you did not notice the night before, scavengers... You quickly turn your eyes away. 

It looks like the fires are completely extinguished now. 
The acrid smell of smoke is still all around you. 
You need to move. You start walking away, in the same direction as yesterday.

... 

$G<<Wake up...>>$c#

"Who's calling...?"$C you mutter, fighting to regain full consciousness. 
You open your eyes, and you become freshly aware of the current situtation. 
It feel like a boulder has been thrown down on you, again. 

You don't know how long you've been asleep. The sun is already high. 
You slowly get back on your feet, aching after a night spent in an uncomfortable position. 
You just hope you didn't get a cold or something worse having slept with your wet clothes out in the open. 
Luckily, wherever you are, the season is warm. 

$c<<Wherever I am...>>$C You shake your head and start moving. 
You just resolutely decided you can't remain there for not even just a second. 
There are many other corpses you did not notice the night before, scavengers... You quickly turn your eyes away. 

It looks like the fires are completely extinguished now. 
The acrid smell of smoke is still all around you. 
You quickly walk away, in the same direction as yesterday.

You are just leaving the last houses of the village behind,
when you notice something further away. 

When you are close enough, you see they are freshly dug graves. A dozen, maybe. 

All there's to see are just piles of earth. No tombstones. Only now nameless corpses. 

You look around, thinking about the fact that someone $Whad$C to be there to bury the bodies. 
Obviously, they could not have dug those holes up and then taken turns in burying each other...$

You laugh at this thought. 
But then a shiver runs down your spine, wondering if that was what had actually happened. 

You manage to distract yourself by studying the ground. 
It looks trodden and loose, as if there was a quite big number of people not so long ago. 
There are two distinctive, neat marks. They look like... 
They look like a chariot wheels track!# Not that you are familiar with old vehicles tracks... 

You follow them with your eyes, disappearing in the distance in front of you,
in an open, semi-desert landscape. 

You don't know where else to go, so you start following the trail. 
Luckily, even a child could do that.

You walked all day long. All you saw were little isolated trees, some bushes and some birds. 
You feel exhausted. It's almost sunset, and you are about to despair. 
But then, you see it. A thin plume of smoke rising. 

$c<<Please not another dead town>>$C you say in your mind, while you start walking faster. 

By the time you get there, it's completely dark. In front of you, an encampment. 
Your survival instinct tells you to lay down and crawl among the sparse low bushes and grass. 

There are many tents around a huge bonfire. Some men are roasting massive chunks of meat on it. 
The smell reaches you nostrils, and you almost faint: you had very little to eat in the last 48 hours. 
Around the fire, many men are dancing to the rhythm of crude songs with obscure words. 
Between a song and a piece of meat, they gulp down impressive mugs of what must be beer. 

You look around: no movement at the sides of the encampment. And then you see them. 

Slaves. Mostly women, and children. 
They are crammed inside several big cages on carriages,
which tracks you now realize you've been following the whole day. Then it dawns on you:

$c<<These thugs must be the responsibles of what I saw at that village!>>$C#

You think about the danger you put yourself in by following them,
but that feeling gets obscured by the disgust and rage. You shouldn't, but you $Whave$C to do something.

choices.desc: You feel you must do something... But it's too dangerous, you don't want to end up in one of those cages.
You know it's a foolish idea, but you can't just leave them to their fate. You must help them.

nodes.text:
You sneak around, looking for anything you could use in order to survive another day, possibly more. 
You need to find supplies, and you want to understand who these people are exactly. 
You need to remain undetected. 

Luckily, it looks like there are no guards around. Everybody must be celebrating... # the... victory?#
Thinking about this, disgust and rage fill you again. 
You take a deep breath to calm down. 

You proceed on resuming your exploration
when the entry of a tent right in front of you shakes as someone is getting out.

dialogues.line: And who would you be...?
dialogues.comment:
You freeze. 
After few paralyzing instants, you manage to close your mouth, trying to dissimulate your fear. 

The voice belongs to a young woman; she is studying you intently, head tilted on one side. 

She is definitely attractive. She has black glinting eyes, long dark brown hair,
glowing $Rred$C under the light of the torches around. 
She's wearing a wide shirt, quite open on her cleavage. 
As for the rest, she's squeezed in a pair of black, thick, stitched leather leggings. 
Your eyes wonder maybe a little too long on the curve of her hips. 

Interesting posture, self confident... with such a delicious narrow waist...

dialogues.line: Hey I asked you a question!
dialogues.comment:
With these words she snaps you out of your examining trance, smiling mischievously. 
You blush, while frantically trying to find something dignifying to say. 
Meanwhile, you notice how strange her English is. You barely understand it. You don't recognize her accent.

replies.line: "Hey hey...! I don't believe you don't recognize me...! Haha come on let's go get drunk..."
"Sorry ma'am, I didn't mean to be disrespectful. Could I explain? It's not as it seems..."

dialogues.precomment: The girl is about to answer, when a third rough, hoarse voice steps in.
dialogues.line: What the heck is going on here?!
dialogues.comment: A huge man appears. His malevolent scowl directed at her as at you.

dialogues.line: Jeorghe, you're always so dear...
dialogues.comment: she answers back with sarcasm.

dialogues.line: You ugly b...!!
Ha! Watch your tongue... or you may lose it!
dialogues.comment:
she interrupts him drawing a sharp knife from her belt in an instant. 
Still, she is pointing it at his crotch, not at his tongue. 

Jeorghe growls, very openly suggesting he would try to kill her if he could. 

Then his attention goes back to you.

dialogues.line: Who is this filth??# A prisoner?# No... There were no men among them... An intruder! A spy!
dialogues.comment:
He starts laughing wildly,
sounding like an outboard motor who doesn't really want to start. 
He grabs a log almost big as your leg, in order to crack your head open.

dialogues.line: I wouldn't do it, if I were you.
dialogues.comment:
A voice behind you. You freeze. 
After few paralyzing istants, you slowly turn around, trying to dissimulate your fear. 

The voice belongs to a young woman; she is studying you intently,
head tilted on one side, leaning on one of the carriages. 

She is definitely attractive. She has black glinting eyes, long dark brown hair,
glowing $Rred$C under the light of the torches around. 
She's wearing a wide shirt, quite open on her cleavage. 
As for the rest, she's squeezed in a pair of black, thick, stitched leather leggings. 
Your eyes wonder maybe a little too long on the curve of her left hip protruding outwards,
since she's leaning with her right elbow on one of the wheels. 

Interesting posture, self confident... with such a delicious narrow waist...#

dialogues.line:
You know? The Chief could express severe disagreement... and heaven knows what he would do to you!
Not to mention what Jeorghe would do to you too...
dialogues.comment:
With these words she snaps you out of your examining trance, smiling mischievously. 
You blush, while frantically trying to find something dignifying to say. 
Meanwhile, you notice how strange her English is. You barely understand it. You don't recognize her accent.

replies.line: "Wai... Wait a second! You won't tell him right? I, erm...!"
"Rrright! Hey I was just looking... Wait, have we met before?"

nodes.text:
$CJeorghe, a mass of muscles, rises his improvised weapon and lunges for you. 

In emergency mode, your brain instantly tells you that you need to act quickly. 
Adrenaline starts pumping through your every vein. 

Where to go, in the middle of a desert?

choices.desc: There's no way you can beat him. Run for your life...!
Fight that thug! Who does he think he is?

nodes.text:
Panicking, you dart away, looking for any kind of cover. 
The brute chases you, smashing everything he encounters on his path and/or swings. 
You slide under the carriages, then run between the nearest tents... 

It's all useless. He is always one step behind you. 
For one split second you get distracted by the noises he makes, and you turn your head a little to watch him. 
It soon proves to be a mistake. 

Looking over your shoulder, you cannot see another man suddenly appearing in front of you. 
He doesn't even try to stop you. He just stands there with arms crossed letting you stumble and fall to his feet,
like a prey trapped for its hunter. 
You realize you are surrounded. There's no way out. 

During a few instants, you can observe every detail of his face. 

His devious grin, anticipating with perverse joy what he's about to do. 
His stench, engulfing you as he rushes towards you. 
Time seems to dilate allowing you to count every hateful, alcoholic capillary of his evil eyes. 

You raise your arm, as if it could protect you from what it's surely going to happen.

You raise your fists ready to engage your aggressor. 

During a few instants, you can observe every detail of his face. 

His devious grin, anticipating with perverse joy what he's about to do. 
His stench, engulfing you as he rushes towards you. 
Time seems to dilate allowing you to count every hateful, alcoholic capillary of his evil eyes. 


Then, it's all over in an instant. 
You don't even have the time to think about the absurdity of the very thought of challenging such a brute. 
The strike, so strong, you don't even feel it. 


$dYou should have run. 


-- GAME OVER --#


$DYou just died. You will start again from the last checkpoint. Make wiser choices, traveler.

dialogues.precomment:
Suddenly, a hissing sound wounds the air!
A flying string appears out of nowhere, winding tightly around Jeorghe's chest,
with stones at its ends which hit him hard when they terminate their spiraling rotation. 

Losing balance, the man falls down on one knee, and lets go of the log. 

Then some kind of $Yshriek$C is heard, and something you can't identify hits the man again, knocking him down,
leaving him growling and wriggling furiously on the ground.#
dialogues.line: Make way, you morons...
dialogues.comment:
you hear the girl from before say as she approached,
breaking into the circle of spectators that has formed. 

Then, everybody backs off, as someone new is arriving. 
You can't see who it is at first, you can only hear an odd jingling sound getting nearer.

dialogues.precomment:
$CThen, he steps into the circle. 

You immediately recognize the Chief:
proud posture, well-kept hair and beard, intelligent, disdainful expression, at times malignant, at times ironic. 
He's tall, more slender than all the other men around. 

He wears several pieces of jewelry around his neck,
and carries a $cbig sword$C in its sheath and a chain (the source of the jingling) both hanging from his belt. 

He stops a few steps from you, his hands on his hips, observing the scene with curiosity.
dialogues.line:
What have you guys been up to? Look at you poor little Jeorghe...!
I think I need to choose better guards for myself!
dialogues.comment: he mocks his man, kicking him a little to tease him.

dialogues.line: Release me! Now!!

dialogues.precomment:
The Chief nods at his men,
and Jeorghe gets untied and escorted, not without any difficulties, somewhere else.
dialogues.line: Who are you? And, please, stand up now...
dialogues.comment: he asks now, gesturing carelessly, and turning abruptly towards you.

dialogues.line: My name is Chris...
dialogues.comment: you answer, after hesitating, just for a moment.

nodes.text:
$M"How come you happen to be here?"$C#

You are not prepared to answer this question. 
You had no chance so far to even think about it.

$c"I.. erm... am from a nearby village. To the north."# $CYou point with your hand in some random direction. 

$c"And, you know... I heard about you guys... What you're doing..."# $CYou try hard to dissimulate your nervousness,
and to look tough and convincing enough. 

$c"So i told myself I should leave that rat hole, and go and reach for you and be of help... To... The cause...?"#

$c"To be honest sir... well, I was on my way home yesterday when... 
I was struck by lightning... Yeah, and then I woke up outside that village..."
$CYou point somewhere behind you. 

$c"After that, not knowing where to go, I just followed your tracks."

$CSome of those guys have been chuckling since you started talking; now almost everybody bursts out. 

You fall silent, you don't know what to expect next. 

The girl is the only one staring seriously at you.

dialogues.line: Enough!
dialogues.comment: Thunders the Chief. Silence falls at once.

dialogues.line:
You have to agree, that's not a great story..." $CHe adds giggling. 
$M"Who do you think might ever believe it?
dialogues.comment:
He draws close to you, examining you head to toes. 
Then he goes back to staring you in the eyes.

dialogues.line: You are no spy. You wouldn't have been so dumb and make all this noise.
dialogues.comment:
He concludes carelessly. 
He looks aside, thoughtful, right hand on his chin, left hand on his right elbow.

dialogues.line: Mmmm... anyway... listen: I am in a good mood today.
dialogues.comment: He snaps his fingers, and draws his face close to yours.

dialogues.line: Here is my proposal: join us!
dialogues.comment:
Immediately a choir of protesting sounds arises. 
Most of the men were hoping to enjoy an execution. 
She remains stoic.

dialogues.precomment: You yourself are surprised. After a while, not having other choices, you say:
dialogues.line: I'm up for it!

dialogues.precomment: ##The Chief smiles, then turns away quickly and while walking away adds:
dialogues.line:
Corolla: find a place for..."$C he hesitates, as if your name sounds strange to him $M"...Kriss."#

"In the end, two hands may steal more than a mouth can eat...
dialogues.comment:
and he disappears, snickering. 

She takes you by the arm and leads you away, under the hateful gazes of the others.
